2.text: Draw a horizon line across your paper.

3.text: Make a pencil mark on the horizon where you want the vanishing point.

4.text: Draw lines that extend from your vanishing point.

5.text: Sketch a geometric object or house to practice perspective.

6.text: Practice drawing landscapes or streets using one-point perspective.

8.text: Use a ruler to draw the horizon line on your paper.

9.text: Mark 2 vanishing points on the horizon.

10.text: Draw 3 or 4 perspective lines that extend from each vanishing point.

11.text: Use the perspective lines to draw the flat top of a box for a practice project.

12.text: Make vertical lines to connect the box from a two-point perspective.

14.text: Use a three-point perspective if you want your drawing to show height.

15.text: Place a vanishing point above or below the horizon line.

16.text: Draw lines that extend from the extra vanishing point.

17.text: Create geometric shapes with extreme depth.

18.text: Now you're ready to draw perspective!
